intro: Taraxacum spectabile, commonly known as the showy dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its bright yellow flower heads and distinctive, lobed leaves. The plant produces a fluffy seed head that disperses seeds via the wind, a common adaptation in the Asteraceae family. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas. Taraxacum spectabile is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters.
